Title: Fetchmail 6.2.5 fixes a remote DoS
Synopsis:
Fetchmail versions 6.2.4 and earlier can be crashed by sending a
    specially-crafted email to a fetchmail user.

Background.Text: Fetchmail is a utility that retrieves and forwards mail from remote systems using IMAP, POP, and other protocols.

Description.Text: Fetchmail versions 6.2.4 and earlier can be crashed by sending a specially-crafted email to a fetchmail user. This problem occurs because Fetchmail does not properly allocate memory for long lines in an incoming email.

Impact.Text: Fetchmail users who receive a malicious email may have their fetchmail program crash.

Workaround.Text: While a workaround is not currently known for this issue, all users are advised to upgrade to the latest version of fetchmail.
